title: Merino â€˜buzzingâ€™ for Arsenal duo after win over Portsmouth
description: Mikel Merino spoke of his delight for Arsenal team-mates Kai Havertz and Gabriel Martinelli after Arsenalâ€™s 4-1 win over Portsmouth in the FA Cup.Martinelli scored a hat-trick to send his side throu...
fullText:
Mikel Merino spoke of his delight for Arsenal team-mates Kai Havertz and Gabriel Martinelli after Arsenalâ€™s 4-1 win over Portsmouth in the FA Cup.

Martinelli scored a hat-trick to send his side through to the fourth round, after what had been a difficult week for the Brazilian having been criticised for trying to push Liverpool Conor Bradley off of the pitch while he was down injured.

But Merino praised the 24-year-old for his response to the noise around him.

â€œWe are really happy for him,â€ he said. â€œHeâ€™s a great guy.Â Everyone that knows him knows heâ€™s a really, really kind kid.

â€œHeâ€™s always smiling. Heâ€™s always kind with everyone. Obviously, you can see that today he came here with the best attitude.Â Knowing heâ€™s a great professional as well, it doesnâ€™t matter the atmosphere around him.Â Heâ€™s always focused on the team, on doing the best thing possible.

â€œWe are very pleased that heâ€™s performing this well.â€

On the incident against Liverpool, Merino added: â€œYeah, obviously sometimes when youâ€™re on the pitch, you donâ€™t have all the clues,Â you donâ€™t have all the information and you can react in a certain way.

â€œBut obviously, everyone knows how good of a kid he is.Â He never pretends to or tries to make someone feel bad.Â It was just a small mistake and he said sorry and the matter ends there.â€

Merino also says he is â€œbuzzingâ€ for Kai Havertz, who made his first Arsenal appearance since August against Portsmouth having been sidelined through injury.

â€œAmazing, amazing,â€ Merino said.

â€œWeâ€™re all buzzing for him to come back after a big, big injury.Â To have him around is so good for everyone, for the atmosphere in the training ground,Â for the support that he gives us as well in the training ground,Â having him around every training session.

â€œAnd now having him on the pitch is one more asset, one more tool for the coach.Â Yes, really happy for him.â€

title: Why Xabi Alonso took off Vinicius Jr. in â€˜least importantâ€™ Supercopa loss vs. Barcelona
description: Xabi Alonso explains Vinicius Juniorâ€™s substitution as Real Madrid fell to Barcelona in the Super Cup final. Xabi Alonso has explained why he took off Vinicius Junior during Real Madridâ€™s Spanish Super Cup final defeat to Barcelona on Sunday.
fullText:
Xabi Alonso explains Vinicius Juniorâ€™s substitution as Real Madrid fell to Barcelona in the Super Cup final.

Xabi Alonso has explained why he took off Vinicius Junior during Real Madridâ€™s Spanish Super Cup final defeat to Barcelona on Sunday.

Viniciusâ€™s goal ended a 16-game drought, but Real Madrid still lost 3â€“2 as Barcelona retained the trophy. Alonso said the decision to substitute him was more about caution and praised the forwardâ€™s impact on the game.

Speaking after the game, Xabi Alonso confirmed that Vinicius Jr. had asked to come off in the closing stages.

Alonso also urged his team to move past the defeat quickly and refocus on the season ahead, while also dismissing the Supercopa as the least of their priorities.

â€œVinicius was very good until the final stages. He asked to come off because of fatigue. There was a lot of humidity. He was a constant threat, the goal was spectacular and he caused a lot of problems down his side.

â€œWe have to move on as soon as possible. Itâ€™s the least important of the competitions we play. We have to look forward, try to get players back from injury, get our morale back and keep going.â€

Real Madrid were without Eder Militao and Antonio Rudiger, while Kylian Mbappe only featured as a late substitute after recovering from a knee injury. Alonso said the absence of key players affected the teamâ€™s balance and stability during the match.

The defeat marked Real Madridâ€™s third consecutive loss to Barcelona in a final. Xabi Alonso admitted that while losing to their biggest rivals is always difficult, the focus must remain on the upcoming fixtures.

â€œItâ€™s never nice to lose a final against a rival. We had our moments, but small details made the difference.â€

Thibaut Courtois also echoed his managerâ€™s frustration, saying Madrid â€œdeserved to winâ€ in the second half but were undone by missed chances.

The goalkeeper added that the team will use the setback as motivation to respond in domestic and European competitions.

With La Liga and Champions League fixtures on the horizon, Alonso said he expects a strong reaction from his players as Madrid look to recover from their latest setback and push for major titles later in the season.

title: Chicago Cubs history unpacked â€”Â January 12
description: A Chicago Cubs-centric digest, with #Cubs, #MLB, and #MiLB content.
fullText:
On Mondays, Wednesdays, and Fridays,Â Bleed Cubbie BlueÂ is pleased to present aÂ Cubs-centric look at baseballâ€™s colorful past.Â Hereâ€™s a handy Cubs timeline, to help you follow the various narrative paths.

â€œMaybe I called it wrong, but itâ€™s official.â€ â€”Â Tom Connolly, HoF Umpire.

Happy birthday to Bill Madlock*, Â itâ€™s drafty in here, and other stories for the discerning reader,

1887Â â€“ TheÂ New York MetropolitansÂ (American Association) buy third basemanÂ Dude EsterbrookÂ from theÂ New York GiantsÂ (NL). Although the Mets are no longer owned by the Giantsâ€™ management, the Giants still seem to get the best of every deal between the two clubs. (2)

1900Â â€“Â Baltimore OriolesÂ managerÂ John McGrawÂ threatens that if theÂ National LeagueÂ drops the Orioles, which are controlled by the owners of theÂ Brooklyn Superbas, he will form anÂ American LeagueÂ team. Two weeks later the NL Circuit Committee recommendsÂ buying outÂ Baltimore,Â Washington,Â Cleveland, andÂ LouisvilleÂ and going to an eight-team league. McGraw then organizes a Baltimore club in the AL, which is still aÂ minor leagueÂ circuit at this point, albeit one with bigger ambitions. (2)

1920Â â€“ A plan developed byÂ Charles EbbetsÂ many years ago is finally adopted: the annualÂ draftingÂ of players from theÂ minor leaguesÂ will be done in inverse order of the final standings. (1,2)

1921Â â€“ JudgeÂ Kenesaw Mountain LandisÂ takes over his new role asÂ CommissionerÂ of baseball. Landis, who is given wide-ranging powers, replaces the three-manÂ National CommissionÂ that had been running the game for nearly two decades. (2)

1950Â â€“ TheÂ New York YankeesÂ sell theirÂ Newark BearsÂ franchise to theÂ Chicago Cubs, who will move the team toÂ Springfield, Massachusetts. The once-proud Bears, owned by the Yankees sinceÂ 1932, finished last in theÂ International LeagueÂ inÂ 1949. (2)

1961Â â€“Â Charlie GrimmÂ andÂ Verlon WalkerÂ are named to theÂ Chicago CubsÂ College of Coaches. Using this system, a different coach will manage the team each month during the season, and members of the group will move between the major league team and its minor league affiliates. (2)

1982Â â€“ In theÂ January draft, theÂ Blue JaysÂ use the #1 pick on OFÂ Kash BeauchampÂ and theÂ CubsÂ follow by taking CÂ Troy Afenir. But theÂ Twins, picking third, strike gold when they take OFÂ Kirby Puckett. Meanwhile, theÂ RedsÂ choose PÂ Randy MyersÂ in the first round while theÂ MetsÂ select OFÂ Kal DanielsÂ in the third round. The 433rd pick overall is OFÂ John Cangelosi, taken by theÂ White Sox. (2)

2018Â â€“ TheÂ Blue JaysÂ sign 3BÂ Josh DonaldsonÂ to one-year deal worth $23 million. It is the largest salary ever given to a player eligible forÂ salary arbitration, besting the $21.6 million given toÂ Bryce HarperÂ by theÂ NationalsÂ last May. Donaldsonâ€™s is not the only record-setting deal signed today: theÂ CubsÂ offer 3BÂ Kris BryantÂ $10.85 million, the most ever for a player eligible for arbitration for the first time. (2)

Cubs Birthdays: George Browne, Roy Easterwood, Phil Mudrock, Paul Reuschel, Bill Madlock*,

475Â â€“ Basiliscus becomes Byzantine Emperor, with a coronation ceremony in the Hebdomon palace in Constantinople.

1554Â â€“ Bayinnaung is crowned King of Burma, assembles the largest empire in the history of Southeast Asia.

1812Â â€“ First cargo arrives in New Orleans by steamboat from Natchez.

1906Â â€“ First time Dow Jones Industrial Average closes above 100 (100.26).

(1) â€”Â Today in Baseball History.

(3) â€”Â Society for American Baseball Research.

(5) â€”Â This Day in Chicago Cubs history.

Some of these items spread from site to site without being fact-checked, and that is why we ask for verifiable sources, in order to help correct the record.

title: Steelers vs. Texans radio coverage: Station, channel, streaming to listen live to NFL wild card playoff game broadcast
description: Here's how fans can listen to Monday night's matchup.
fullText:
Steelers vs. Texans radio coverage: Station, channel, streaming to listen live to NFL wild card playoff game broadcast originally appeared on The Sporting News. Add The Sporting News as a Preferred Source by clicking here.

The wild-card round of the playoffs will close out with a fascinating matchup on Monday night.

The Pittsburgh Steelers were the last team in the playoff field, defeating the Baltimore Ravens on Sunday night to claim the AFC North crown. Their reward is a home playoff game as the No. 4 seed in the AFC against the top wild-card team, the Houston Texans.

Houston is one of the hottest teams in the league, having won nine-straight games after starting the year 3-5. The Texans stalwart defense will have to try and smart Steelers quarterback Aaron Rodgers, who returns to the playoffs for the first time since the 2021 season.

Pittsburgh has lost six-straight playoff games dating back to the 2016 AFC Championship game, while Houston has won a playoff game in two-straight seasons. Here's how fans can listen to this matchup in wild-card weekend.

National radio channels:Â SiriusXMÂ channels 225Â (Steelers), 226Â (Texans)

Steelers radio channels:Â WDVE 102.5 FM and WBGG 970 AM

Texans radio channels:Â Sports Radio 610 and The Bull 100.3 FM

Listeners looking for the Steelers-Texans game can find it on SiriusXM, as the Steelers broadcast will be on channel 225 and the Texans broadcast on 226. Local fans in Pittsburgh can find the game onÂ WDVE 102.5 FM or WBGG 970 AM, while local Houston fan can tune into Sports Radio 610 or The Bull 100.3 FM.

If you are a new subscriber to SiriusXM, you can get your first month for free.Â Listen to every NFL game live, plus other sports like college football, MLB, NBA, NHL, NASCAR and more. Stay updated with all the news and analysis from SiriusXM NFL Radio and other sport-specific channels.

The wild-card matchup between the Steelers and Texans will take place at 8:00 p.m. ET from Acrisure Stadium in Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania.

title: Monday Bird Droppings: When will the major free agents sign?
description: Five of MLBâ€™s top 10 free agents remain available. Letâ€™s have some fun, Orioles.
fullText:
Weâ€™re not all that far off now from spring training. Just one month remains until pitchers and catchers report to camp. But this MLB offseason feels anything but complete.

Plenty of top-tier free agents have yet to sign anywhere. Of MLB Trade Rumorsâ€™ top 10 ranked FAs, half of them remain on the market: Kyle Tucker (#1), Bo Bichette (#2), Framber Valdez (#6), Cody Bellinger (#8), and Ranger SuÃ¡rez (#10). And #5 on that list, Alex Bregman, just joined the Cubs two days ago.

Thereâ€™s a lot of great talent still available for whichever teams are willing to pay for it. Orioles fans, of course, are hoping that Baltimore is one of those teams. Valdez or SuÃ¡rez, the two pitchers on that list, are the most sensible fits for the Birds. But hey, why stop there? Iâ€™ve been beating the Kyle Tucker drum this offseason and Iâ€™m not going to stop now, even though the Oâ€™s acquired Taylor Ward earlier this winter. I say if you have the financial wherewithal to add a premium free agent â€” which the Orioles do, if the Pete Alonso signing is any indication â€” then you might as well be in discussions with all the top guys, even if theyâ€™re not an obvious fit on the roster. Sign Tucker to play right field, and you could have Dylan Beavers back up at all three outfield positions. Iâ€™m not particularly concerned about what would happen to Tyler Oâ€™Neill in that scenario.

Heck, sign Bo Bichette to play second base. You could move Jackson Holliday to, I donâ€™t know, center field? Or go ahead and swipe Cody Bellinger out from under the Yankeesâ€™ noses. Heâ€™s not the defensive center fielder he once was, but Iâ€™d probably trust him more than Colton Cowser out there, and heâ€™s certainly a better hitter.

Maybe Iâ€™m only being half-serious with these suggestions. The Oâ€™s donâ€™t have unlimited cash and would probably prefer to stick to the more realistic options. But can anyone say theyâ€™d truly be upset if the Oâ€™s came out of nowhere and landed someone like Tucker, Bichette, or Bellinger, in addition to one of the pitchers? What an offseason that would be.

So go ahead, Orioles. Youâ€™ve got a month left to do something truly awesome. Letâ€™s have some fun, shall we?

Can Bradfield be Oriolesâ€™ Opening Day centerfielder? | MAILBAG â€“ BaltimoreBaseball.com

This mailbag question comes from someone who did not follow Bradfieldâ€™s 2025 season, I suppose. Rich Dubroff rightly responds that thereâ€™s no chance of it happening.

As solid offseason winds down, is there pressure on Oâ€™s to add one more starter? â€“ Steve Melewski

Depends what you mean by â€œpressure.â€ I donâ€™t think Elias will be fired or anything if he doesnâ€™t add another starter. But I hope heâ€™s prepared for Orioles fans to angrily voice their displeasure on the internet. Take that, Mike!

This, that and the other â€“ School of Roch

Gunnar Henderson is hyped about the World Baseball Classic. You and me both, Gunnar.

Is today your birthday? Happy birthday! Six former Orioles were born on this day, including (Na Na Na-Na-Na) Kim! Hyun! Soo!, who turns 38. After his brief MLB stint with the Birds from 2016-17, Kim is still going strong in the Korea Baseball Organization, spending the past eight years with the LG Twins. Other ex-Oâ€™s celebrating Jan. 12 birthdays are right-handers Chris Ray (44) and Luis Ayala (48), infielders Tim Hulett (66) and Juan Bonilla (70), and lefty Paul Gilliford (81).

On this date in 2007, the Orioles traded righty Rodrigo LÃ³pez to the Rockies for two prospects. LÃ³pez had been a solid starter for the Oâ€™s for five seasons, averaging more than 180 innings per year and thrice serving as the Opening Day starter. He was the AL Rookie of the Year runner-up in 2002. In his last season with the Birds, though, LÃ³pez led the league in both losses (18) and earned runs allowed (124).

title: Your weekly look at the records Josh Allen broke in the Billsâ€™ last game
description: Buffalo Bills quarterback Josh Allen sets a record every week. This time, it was playoff records.
fullText:
Josh Allen has a bunch of NFL records, and Sunday he keeps going. The Buffalo Bills QB threw a touchdown pass and scored two rushing touchdowns in addition to gaining a bunch of yards on the ground and through the air.

Josh Allen came into the game as the Billsâ€™ leader in playoff yardage with 4043 yards through passing, rushing, and receiving. He padded that with 306 yards against the Jaguars.

Allen came into the game with 25 passing touchdowns, 7 rushing touchdowns, and a receiving touchdown for 33 total touchdowns, adding three 

Allen added two rushing touchdowns in the game to move into second place all by himself in postseason rushing touchdowns by a quarterback. He entered one behind Steve Young for second place. Jalen Hurts is the leader with 10, now Allen has nine, Young has eight, and Tom Brady and Patrick Mahomes have seven.

Jalen Hurts â€“ 10
Josh Allen â€“ 9
Steve Young â€“ 8
Tom Brady and Patrick Mahomes â€“ 7

Wins arenâ€™t a QB stat, there are a team stat. BUT the NFL tracks them, and Tom Brady had a win in eight consecutive postseasons from 2011 to 2018. Allen joins Patrick Mahomes in 2018 to 2024 as players with seven straight seasons with a playoff win. If Allen and the Bills win a game in the 2026 postseason a year from now, Allen will tie Bradyâ€™s record.

Tom Brady â€“ eight straight seaons
Josh Allen â€“ seven straight seasons*
Patrick Mahomes â€“ seven straight seasons

Only four teams in NFL history have won games in six straight postseasons. The Bills, Patriots, and Chiefs in addition to the 1990s Dallas Cowboys. In 1991, Steve Beuerlein won a game for the Cowboys in place of an injured Troy Aikman, and the HOFer won the next five years.

Allen is the first QB in NFL history to complete 80% of his passes AND rush for more than one touchdown in a single playoff game.

title: Matthew Golden's Breakout Makes Free Agency Decision Easier
description: Green Bay Packers rookie wide receiver Matthew Golden had a breakout performance in the Wild Card Round.
fullText:
The Green Bay Packers don't have many positives to take away from their Wild Card collapse to the Chicago Bears. Rookie wide receiver Matthew Golden was one of the few bright spots, having the best game of his career.

The Packers took Golden with the 23rd overall pick in the NFL Draft. Heading into the season, he was expected to be one of the top weapons for quarterback Jordan Love, but he was behind Christian Watson, Romeo Doubs, Jayden Reed, Dontayvion Wicks, and even Bo Melton at times.

Golden should've at least been the fourth receiver in the offense, if not in a bigger role, as evidenced by his performance against Chicago.

The 22-year-old wideout hauled in four receptions for 84 yards and a touchdown. Golden's explosiveness and ability to make clutch catches were pivotal for the Packers' offense.

While they didn't come away with the win, Golden's impact was felt and proves that the Packers should've had him on the field earlier in the season.

In 14 games in the regular season, Golden was targeted 44 times, catching 29 passes for 361 yards, and did not find the endzone.

Golden showcased in the playoffs why the Packers drafted him and what he is capable of doing in an expanded role. With his emergence, it makes a free agency decision that much easier.

Wide receiver Romeo Doubs is entering free agency, and with a lot of Green Bay's cap space being tied up to Jordan Love and Micah Parsons, every contract decision is pivotal.

Doubs is a quality receiver, as he had 55 receptions for 724 yards and six touchdowns in the 2025 season. He was also crucial in the playoff matchup, as he had eight receptions for 124 yards and a touchdown.

The Packers would love to keep Doubs, but there are bigger needs, such as cornerback, the defensive line, and offensive line depth.

Green Bay has Watson, Golden, Reed, Wicks, and Savion Williams under contract for the 2026 season, giving them a solid receiver room without Doubs.

Unless the Packers are able to work out a cheap contract with Doubs, they should let him go, allow Golden to take on a bigger role, and upgrade the roster elsewhere for the 2026 season.

title: New York Yankees' Kyle Tucker Hopes Slammed With Awful News
description: The New York Yankees are apparently pursuing Kyle Tucker, but they just received some bad news in that department.
fullText:
The New York Yankees have reportedly moved away from Cody Bellinger and have pivoted to other options in MLB free agency. One of those options? Kyle Tucker.

Tucker is the jewel of this year's free-agent class and was viewed as a potential fit for the Yankees heading into the winter, but it didn't appear that New York had much interest in the four-time All-Star.

However, recent events may have changed things for the Bronx Bombers, as Bellinger seems to be asking for $36-37 million annually, a rather steep price for a merely good â€” not great â€” 30-year-old player with an injury history.

As a result, the Yankees have evidently decided to turn their attention to Tucker, who was said to be seeking a $400 million contract at the outset of he offseason, but may have reduced his demands as a result of a slow market.

But unfortunately, it does not appear that New York is one of the favorites to sign him.

Former MLB general manager Jim Duquette has revealed that the Toronto Blue Jays, Los Angeles Dodgers and New York Mets are the three teams most connected to Tucker and have all met with the outfielder either in person or via video call.

Duquette wondered if any one of those three ballclubs would "increase" their offers, indicating that each of those teams have already made overtures to Tucker.

So, where do the Yankees fit in all of this? Have they made Tucker an offer? Are they laying in the weeds? Are they really not that interested in the former Houston Astros and Chicago Cubs star?

It's also entirely possible that Alex Bregman's recent five-year, $175 million contract with the Cubs has rejuvenated Tucker's market and, therefore, his asking price, which may have caused the Yanks to bow out of the process.

New York has not made a single notable addition this winter. The Yankees are supposedly trying to make a trade for a starting pitcher, but things appear to be moving at a snail's pace on that front.

As far as signing big-name free agents? Outside of Bellinger, New York has not seemed serious about anyone. It was also linked to Bo Bichette, but it seems hard to imagine the Yanks meeting his asking price, especially considering how bad he is defensively.

If the Yankees really want Tucker, they better jump in now, because all three of the teams mentioned have deep pockets and are clearly not afraid to spend.

title: Organizers condemn 'unacceptable behavior of players and officials' after fighting at Africa Cup
description: Organizers of the Africa Cup of Nations have condemned the â€œunacceptable behavior of players and officialsâ€ and is reviewing video evidence of journalists fighting after the quarterfinal between Algeria and Nigeria.  The Confederation of African Football said Monday it was also investigating match incidents during the quarterfinal between Cameroon and host nation Morocco.
fullText:
RABAT, Morocco (AP) â€” Organizers of the Africa Cup of Nations have condemned the â€œunacceptable behavior of players and officialsâ€ and is reviewing video evidence of journalists fighting after the quarterfinal between Algeria and Nigeria.

The Confederation of African Football said Monday it was also investigating match incidents during the quarterfinal between Cameroon and host nation Morocco.

â€œCAF strongly condemns any inappropriate behavior which occurs during matches, especially those targeting the refereeing team or match organizers,â€ CAF said in a statement. â€œAppropriate actions will be sought against anyone whose behavior is not consistent with professional conduct at CAF events.â€

Scuffles broke out between players and team officials on the field after Algeriaâ€™s defeat by Nigeria in Marrakech on Saturday.

Referee Issa Sy was shielded from irate Algeria team staff and was escorted off the field. Video clips showed Sy was still being pursued in the mixed zone for media and broadcasters as he made his way to his cabin.

Video also showed accredited media fighting in the mixed zone as they waited for players to pass through for interviews after the match.

â€œCAF has referred the matters to the disciplinary board for investigation and has called for appropriate action to be taken if the identified persons were to be found guilty of any wrongdoing,â€ CAF said.

AP at the Africa Cup: https://apnews.com/hub/africa-cup-of-nations

title: Norwich City fan dies at FA Cup home fixture
description: The club sends its "heartfelt condolences" to the supporter's family.
fullText:
A Norwich City fan died after collapsing at the club's third-round FA Cup fixture on Sunday.

The club said the home supporter, who was in their 80s, suffered a medical emergency shortly after the final whistle against Walsall at Carrow Road.

A spokesperson thanked medical staff, stewards and nearby supporters for assisting during the incident, and said it would "ensure those involved receive the appropriate care".

"Everyone at Norwich City would like to send their heartfelt condolences to the supporter's family and friends," the club added.

The statement said the club would work with police to provide support "at this distressing time".

Norfolk Police said that despite paramedics carrying out treatment, he was pronounced dead at the scene.

A file has been passed to the coroner and the death is not thought to be suspicious, police added.

The news was met with hundreds of supportive comments from football fans and groups, as well as Walsall supporters and East Anglian rivals Ipswich Town.

One wrote that the emergency services had attended the incident in the Regency Stand very quickly.

Walsall FC also posted on X: "The thoughts of everyone at Walsall Football Club are with the individual's family and friends at this most difficult time."

Follow Norfolk news on BBC Sounds, Facebook, Instagram and X.

title: LSU football lands transfer portal defensive lineman from Sun Belt
description: LSU landed a commitment from former South Alabama defensive lineman Achilles Woods on Sunday evening. Woods has three seasons of eligibility left.
fullText:
Former South Alabama edge rusher Achilles Woods committed to LSU Sunday evening, per On3â€™s Pete Nakos. He has three seasons of eligibility remaining.

Woods is another upside-based swing from Blake Baker and his defensive staff. He wasnâ€™t particularly productive this season, recording five pressures, two sacks, five tackles and two run stops in 2025, per Pro Football Focus. Although some list Woods as an edge rusher, he didnâ€™t line up there often, instead playing primarily as a three-technique.

Woods is a key depth addition, however. LSU lost several defensive linemen to the transfer portal this offseason, and although theyâ€™ve done a high-quality job replacing them so far, it never hurts to continue fortifying the position. Woods makes five defensive line signees from the portal for LSU, including former Tennessee edge rusher Jordan Ross, former Clemson defensive lineman Stephiylan Green, former Auburn defensive lineman Malik Blocton, and former South Carolina edge rusher Jaylen Brown.

It will be interesting to see how snaps are distributed at the position next season, as the Tigers also signed the No. 1- and No. 2-ranked defensive linemen in the Class of 2026, Richard Anderson and Lamar Brown.

This article originally appeared on LSU Wire: LSU football lands transfer portal defensive lineman from Sun Belt

title: Liverpool to make winter move for Dortmund defender?
description: With Conor Bradley expected to be out for several months due to a knee injury, Liverpool could turn to Germany for a replacement.According to Absolut Fussball, the Reds are considering a winter move f...
fullText:
With Conor Bradley expected to be out for several months due to a knee injury, Liverpool could turn to Germany for a replacement.

According to Absolut Fussball, the Reds are considering a winter move for Borussia Dortmundâ€™s Julian Ryerson.

Battling with Yan Couto for the right wing-back spot, the Norwegian international has featured 22 times for BVB this season, starting 15 of those games.

He most recently played the full 90 minutes as Dortmund drew 3-3 with Eintracht Frankfurt on Friday, earning praise from head coach Niko KovaÄ.

â€œYou can see that Julian Ryerson is a Viking. Thatâ€™s how he plays football. He spares neither himself nor the opponent and drives forward with a lot of energy,â€ KovaÄ said.

FC Barcelona have previously been mentioned as suitors for the 28-year-old, who remains under contract with Dortmund until 2028.

title: Texas A&M's 2026 WR corps is all but complete after latest addition
description: Texas A&M's 2026 wide receiver rotation looks complete after adding WR Isaiah Horton, but several names remain in the mix.
fullText:
Texas A&M's 2026 wide receiver rotation is all but complete after landing a massive commitment from Alabama transfer wideout Isaiah Horton, who, after entering the portal on Thursday, took one visit to College Station this weekend, and announced his intention to play for the Aggies on Sunday night.

Last season, Texas A&M's one and only weakness in its wide receiver rotation was the lack of size on the boundary, which also hurt the red zone offense, lacking a 50/50 deep shot threat that could stretch the field and help starting quarterback Marcel Reed spread the ball around at every level of the field.

With the return of star wide receiver Mario Craver, along with ascending wideouts Ashton Bethel-Roman and Terry Bussey, combined with several incoming freshmen, speed and separation aren't an issue, and Horton provides stability as a man-beater on the outside to create chunk gains and open up the offense.

Last season, Marcel Reed threw for 3,192 yards and 25 touchdowns, with seven of those scores coming off deep shots of 20 yards or more, while his 39% completion percentage on those throws should improve with Horton's size posing an advantage. While five of his eleven interceptions came between the numbers, four were thrown along the left boundary, mainly due to the lack of size at wide receiver against average-sized defensive backs.

Mario Craver is one of the fastest players in college football, but is a mere 5'9", and should have his best season yet in the Z or slot receiver role with Hortmon on the field, as the coverage will now have to focus on the Alabama transfer, especially if he finds early success in SEC play.

Barring any changes, including Auburn transfer WR Malcolm Simmon's impending decision and Colorado transfer receiver Dre'Lon Miller's visit to College Station this weekend, Isaiah Hortmon looks like the final piece of the puzzle for Texas A&M's 2026 wide receiver corps.

If the 2025 Texas A&M WR group had one weakness, it was their lack of a big-bodied WRs who can be an outside man beater and grab 50-50 balls. New A&M WR Isaiah Horton can be that guy and led Alabama with eight receiving TDs in 2025. pic.twitter.com/Ui86ViPjcQ

â€” Carter Karels (@CarterKarels) January 11, 2026

Contact/Follow usÂ @AggiesWireÂ on XÂ (formerly Twitter) and like our page onÂ FacebookÂ to follow ongoing coverage of Texas A&M news, notes and opinions.Â Follow Cameron on X:Â @CameronOhnysty.

This article originally appeared on Aggies Wire: Texas A&M's 2026 WR corps looks complete after adding Isaiah Horton

title: Ex-Chiefs OL stars in bizarre highlight play during Wild Card game
description: Ex-Kansas City Chiefs offensive tackle Darian Kinnard stars in bizarre highlight play during Wild Card game | @EdEastonJr
fullText:
The Kansas City Chiefs didn't qualify for the playoffs after a disappointing 2025 regular season. The teams playing during the NFL's Super Wild Card weekend feature numerous former Chiefs players who contributed to past Super Bowl seasons.

The Chicago Bears' dramatic comeback victory over the Green Bay Packers in Saturday's Wild Card game featured an unusual moment. Packers quarterback Jordan Love completed a pass to offensive lineman and former Chiefs 2022 draft pick Darian Kinnard.

He gained 6 yards before being stripped of the ball and then kicking it another 15 yards up the field, which could have been a Bears recovery. The ball was knocked out of bounds by Chicago while trying to dive on top of it. The result of the wild moment was the Packers' ball at the spot where Kinnard fumbled, since it couldn't be advanced by falling out of bounds.

WHAT JUST HAPPENED ğŸ˜³

GBvsCHI on Prime Video
Also streaming on @NFLPlus pic.twitter.com/Rdmni2pnHw

Kinnard is one of only two players to win three consecutive Super Bowls, accomplishing it with wins in Super Bowls LVII and LVIII with the Chiefs and LIX with the Philadelphia Eagles.

This article originally appeared on Chiefs Wire: Ex-Chiefs OL stars in bizarre highlight play during Wild Card game

title: How Wisconsin found success going small against big Michigan frontcourt
description: Wisconsin found success with 'small ball' lineup combinations during crucial stretches of the Badgers' upset win over No. 1 Michigan.
fullText:
ANN ARBOR, Mich. â€“ Greg Gard rattled off three numbers after a recent practice as he looked ahead to the Wisconsin Badgersâ€™ challenge against No. 1 Michigan that loomed a few days away.

â€œ7-4, 6-10, 6-9,â€ Gard told reporters. â€œThatâ€™s your three, four, five.â€

Those were roughly â€“ give or take an inch â€“ the heights of Michigan starters Aday Mara, Yaxel Lendeborg and Morez Johnson Jr.

Wisconsinâ€™s answer to that trio consisted of some different numbers. The Badgers started with players who were 7-0, 6-10 and 6-6, and they used even smaller groupings at various points in the game, including 7-0, 6-5, 6-5.

Either way, they were winning numbers as Wisconsin went small at times against Michigan â€“ â€œthe biggest team weâ€™ve played across the board,â€ John Blackwell said â€“ and walked away with a big 91-88 upset along with its first road win and first Quad 1 win of the season.

â€œThe small lineup really didnâ€™t hurt us that much,â€ Wisconsin coach Greg Gard said after the game. â€œWeâ€™re really active, we really fly around when weâ€™re small, and we cover for each other.â€

Wisconsin played about nine minutes with four guards and one forward on the floor. That included a four-plus-minute stretch during the first half in which Wisconsin had a 16-10 scoring advantage. Overall, UW outscored Michigan, 24-18, when it had four guards on the floor.

Braeden Carrington was a key part of that success, amassing a team-high nine rebounds while essentially serving as UWâ€™s guy at the No. 4 spot in the four-guard lineup. Gard thought Carringtonâ€™s â€œexperience showedâ€ in the 91-88 win as a â€œvet thatâ€™s been in these types of games.â€

â€œHeâ€™s a terrific rebounder for his size, and heâ€™s got competitive toughness to him that I think has blossomed and grown in the last few weeks,â€ Gard said of the 6-foot-5 guard who previously played at Minnesota and Tulsa. â€œItâ€™s gotten better.â€

Wisconsinâ€™s smaller lineup was somewhat of a necessity given the Badgersâ€™ lack of depth in the frontcourt. Portland transfer Austin Rapp, who had been averaging 23.3 minutes per game, missed his second consecutive game with an injury.

Aside from starters Nolan Winter and Aleksas Bieliauskas, freshman seven-footer Will Garlock was the only other available player who is taller than 6-foot-6 for the Michigan game. Garlock has played no more than nine minutes in any of the Badgersâ€™ games against high-major foes this season.

â€œThis is deep water for Will as a freshman,â€ Gard said of the former three-star recruit from Middleton. â€œHe was playing DeForest High School a year ago. So this is a little different. So heâ€™s figuring some things out.â€

Winter played 36 minutes, Bieliauskas played 31 minutes and Garlock played four minutes against Michigan.

â€œWe were able to rotate them to some degree to try to keep them both fresh,â€ Gard said of Winter and Bieliauskas. â€œOr fresher.â€

Winter and Bieliauskas both delivered amid their heavy workloads. Bieliauskas had a career-high 17 points and made four consecutive 3-pointers that served as a turning point in the win. Winter had nine points on 3-of-4 shooting from 3-point range along with three rebounds and two assists.

â€œWhen you have bigs that are skilled and can pass and dribble and shoot, it puts a lot of pressure on a defense, and we were able to use some of that to our advantage,â€ Gard said.

It is unclear whether Rapp will be available to play â€“ and consequently whether the Badgers will have a fourth frontcourt option â€“ on Jan. 13 against Minnesota.

â€œHe did some workouts here today,â€ Gard said after the teamâ€™s Jan. 11 practice in Madison. â€œWe didnâ€™t do a lot of live stuff or body-on-body stuff. So heâ€™s working with the trainer, working with our assistants in terms of repping and getting some things back in. So weâ€™ll see how he responds, and itâ€™ll obviously be the medical staffâ€™s call of what he will do.â€

But even if Rapp was available to take some of the workload as well, the Badgers may have still gone with the smaller lineup at times.

â€œItâ€™s something we have talked about, even prior to Rappâ€™s injury,â€ Gard said. â€œWe felt small ball was a thing we could take advantage of, and obviously our guys have done a good job of filling into those roles.â€

But Wisconsinâ€™s upset also showed that â€œyou can make a lot of good things happen when you play hard.â€ That certainly was not exclusive to the Badgersâ€™ nine minutes of playing with a smaller lineup either.

â€œThe biggest common denominator was everybody that stepped on the floor had a lot of fight to them,â€ Gard said moments after the Badgersâ€™ big upset. â€œThat was the thing that â€“ regardless of how many minutes, how many points â€“ everybody came ready to compete.â€

This article originally appeared on Milwaukee Journal Sentinel: Wisconsin Badgers find success going small vs big Michigan frontcourt

title: NFL Draft 2026: Updated order after Wild Card weekend
description: Here is the updated order for the 2026 NFL Draft after Wild Card weekend
fullText:
The NFLâ€™s Wild Card weekend will set the eight teams that will move on to next weekâ€™s Divisional Round.

It will also lock six more teams into their spots for the 2026 NFL Draft.

The five teams that lost this past weekend now know where they will be picking in the upcoming NFL Draft, with the Carolina Panthers now slotted into the 19th pick, leading off the playoff teams. Two of those teams â€” the Green Bay Packers and the Jacksonville Jaguars â€” traded those picks away, meaning the Dallas Cowboys and the Cleveland Browns now know where their second picks will be on the first night of the 2026 NFL Draft.

One more team will learn their draft position tonight, when the Pittsburgh Steelers host the Houston Texans in the final game of Wild Card Weekend.

Here is the updated order for the 2026 NFL Draft.

Los Angeles Rams (via Atlanta Falcons)

New York Jets (via Indianapolis Colts)

Dallas Cowboys (via Green Bay Packers)

Cleveland Browns (via Jacksonville Jaguars)

Tonightâ€™s game between the Texans and the Steelers will lock in one of those teams into their draft slot. As things stand, the Steelers are picking 21st, and that is where they will land should they lose tonight.

If the Texans lose, they will slot in at No. 23, dropping the Chargers down to No. 21 and the Eagles down to No. 22.

The Browns, courtesy of the Travis Hunter Jr. trade, are locked into the No. 24 spot as Jacksonville is guaranteed to have the best record of any of the teams that lost during Wild Card weekend.

title: 'We are playing for our reputation' every game
description: Arsenal midfielder Mikel Merino says "every game matters" for the team, insisting they are not prioritising one competition over the other.  The Gunners are still fighting on four fronts this season after a  4-1 win over Portsmouth on Sunday secured them a place in the fourth round of the FA Cup.  "It doesn't matter if it's the Carabao Cup, the FA Cup or a friendly," Merino said.
fullText:
Arsenal midfielder Mikel Merino says "every game matters" for the team, insisting they are not prioritising one competition over the other.

The Gunners are still fighting on four fronts this season after a 4-1 win over Portsmouth on Sunday secured them a place in the fourth round of the FA Cup.

They are also sitting top of both the Premier League and Champions League tables, while they face London rivals Chelsea on Wednesday in the first leg of their Carabao Cup semi-final.

"It doesn't matter if it's the Carabao Cup, the FA Cup or a friendly," Merino said.

"It's not only about the competition we're playing for, it's that we're playing for the badge, we are playing for our reputation. Every game that we wear this shirt, we have to do our best, we have to win and we have to put in a good performance.

"The main thing is to show that we are Arsenal and we are ready to compete every single time. The rest will take care of itself."

Mikel Arteta's side survived a brief scare on Sunday, with Portsmouth taking an early lead, but once again it was their prowess at set-pieces that turned it around.

It has been a discussion point throughout this campaign, and asked about the importance of set-pieces for the team, Merino said: "It doesn't change. It's always the same mentality and same hard work every training session.

"We practise every game. We go with the same attitude, but obviously sometimes the ball goes in and sometimes it doesn't. We let you guys talk about it. But, to be honest, it's our standards, our basics, our principles.

"We try to apply them, and [against Portsmouth] we were lucky. It showed that the good work we do has some good results."

title: New York Giants racked up nearly $500,000 in fines from NFL in 2025
description: It was a fine frenzy in East Rutherford this past season, with the New York Giants racking up nearly half a million in NFL fines.
fullText:
It was a fine frenzy in East Rutherford this past season, with the NFL slapping the New York Giants organization, coaches, and players with fines totalling nearly $500,000. That represents roughly 12.5% of the average yearly total across the league ($4 million).

But it all goes to a good cause:

The fines collected are donated to the Professional Athletes Foundation to support Legends in need and the NFL Foundation to further support the health, safety and wellness of athletes across all levels, including youth football and the communities that support the game.

The following data was accumulated through the NFL's operations department, compiled as part of their gameday accountability tracker. It does not include or account for any private appeals and their subsequent results.

Here's a look at all fines levied against the Giants in 2025:

OL James Hudson, unnecessary roughness (striking/kicking/kneeing): $12,172

LB Brian Burns, unsportsmanlike conduct (taunting): $11,593

Giants organization, violating concussion protocol: $200,000

HC Brian Daboll, conduct detrimental to the league: $100,000

RB Cam Skattebo, conduct detrimental to the league: $15,000

S Tyler Nubin, unnecessary roughness (hip-drop tackle): $10,324

RB Cam Skattebo, unnecessary roughness (striking/kicking/tripping/kneeing): $6,157

RB Tyrone Tracy Jr., unnecessary roughness (use of the helmet): $5,731

DT Rakeem Nunez-Roches, unnecessary roughness (use of the helmet): $23,186

S Dane Belton, unnecessary roughness (striking/kicking/tripping/kneeing): $7,201

LB Demetrius Flannigan-Fowles, unnecessary roughness (use of the helmet): $7,292

TE Theo Johnson, unnecessary rough (late hit): $6,488

CB Dru Phillips, unnecessary roughness (hit on defenseless player): $7,292

CB Dru Phillips, unnecessary roughness (pulling player off a pile): $7,293

DB Raheem Layne, unnecessary roughness (use of the helmet): $5,722

S Tyler Nubin, unsportsmanlike conduct (illegal celebration and vulgar acts): $10,324

CB Rico Payton, unnecessary roughness (late hit): $5,333

CB Rico Payton, unnecessary roughness (striking/kicking/tripping/kneeing): $5,333

CB Dru Phillips, unnecessary roughness (late hit): $7,293

Individual franchise/coach/player fines: 14

Player fined most times: S Dane Belton (3)

Largest fine: Giants organization ($200,000)

Player with highest fine total: DT Rakeem Nunez-Roches ($23,186)

Player with largest fine: DT Rakeem Nunez-Roches ($23,186)

Cumulative fine total: $453,734

This article originally appeared on Giants Wire: New York Giants racked up nearly $500,000 in fines from NFL in 2025

title: 49ers don't expect LB Fred Warner to return for Seahawks game
description: The 49ers have left the door open for linebacker Fred Warner to return to action in the playoffs, but it isn't likely to happen in the divisional round.
fullText:
The 49ers have left the door open for linebacker Fred Warner to return to action in the playoffs, but it isn't likely to happen in the divisional round.

Warner was seen working on the side at practices leading up to Sunday's win over the Eagles, which led to a question for head coach Kyle Shanahan about his status in his postgame press conference. Shanahan was asked about the chances that Warner is formally designated to return to action before the team's trip to Seattle next Saturday night.

"Not very high," Shanahan said, via 49ersWebzone.com.

Shanahan has previously pointed to the conference championship game as a potential return date for Warner. The 49ers have a chance to get there, but they'll now have to do it without tight end George Kittle as well as Warner and several others who have suffered serious injuries over the course of the season.

title: Man United interim manager options: Best candidates for temporary role as Ruben Amorim replacement
description: Manchester United are said to have identified three main candidates to take interim charge of the team.
fullText:
Man United interim manager options: Best candidates for temporary role as Ruben Amorim replacement originally appeared on The Sporting News. Add The Sporting News as a Preferred Source by clicking here.

Manchester United look set to place an interim manager in charge of the first team for the third time in just over five years, having first done so with Ole Gunnar Solskjaer in 2018 and then Ralf Rangnick in 2021.

Ruben Amorim was dramatically sacked on January 5 after falling out with club bosses and failing to demonstrate sufficient progress with the team, leaving United needing to find a seventh permanent boss since Sir Alex Ferguson's retirement in 2013.

However, just as they did when Jose Mourinho and then Ole Gunnar Solskjaer were dismissed, the Red Devils appear set to hire an interim boss to oversee matters until the end of the season, at which point a full-time replacement for Amorim will be brought in.

There are three clear candidates for the position, all of whom have strong ties to the club: Solskjaer, Darren Fletcher, and Michael Carrick.

The Sporting News assesses which of the three represents the best short-term option.

MORE:Amorim's record compared to post-Ferguson managers | Why Amorim lost his job

Below are the current best options for United as they look for someone to take charge of the first team for the remainder of 2025/26.

Widespread reports in England on January 5 made it clear that Solskjaer was keen on the idea of returning to United for another crack at the manager job.

This time, he would almost certainly be brought on for an interim role only and then leave at the end of the season, regardless of the team's results. Solskjaer got the permanent job in 2019 after a brilliant spell as temporary boss, but he was unable to build on that early promise, and most supporters were desperate for a change by the time he was sacked in November 2021. United's powerbrokers won't want to repeat that mistake.

He would be a popular choice as interim manager given that positive previous spell, and having left Besiktas in August, his appointment would not accrue any compensation costs. However, at this stage, it appears he is behind Carrick in the running.

Likelihood:Â 5/10
Suitability:Â 6/10

Fletcher took charge of the team for the league game at Burnley and the FA Cup match at home to Brighton & Hove Albion, which effectively gave him an audition for the interim role. The fact those matches ended in a 2-2 draw and 2-1 defeat may well have counted against him.

Like Solskjaer and Carrick, Fletcher enjoyed a hugely successful playing career at United and has been part of their coaching set-up since 2020, initially working with the youth sides before taking on a role as technical director.

Fletcher is considered a knowledgeable and astute coach and someone with a degree of gravitas at the club, but his lack of experience in management at senior level means he was always somewhat up against it to prove he is the right man to oversee matters until the end of the season.

Likelihood:Â 4/10
Suitability:Â 4/10

Carrick joined United's coaching staff under Mourinho after retiring at the end of a glittering playing career in 2018. He was kept on by Solskjaer, and, when the Norwegian was dismissed, Carrick took temporary charge of the team, beating Villarreal and Arsenal before leaving the club once Ralf Rangnick came on board.

The ex-midfielder is another who knows Old Trafford well and has experienced two very different styles of management. His time at Middlesbrough was a mixed bag. He got them very close to promotion, as well as the semifinals of the Carabao Cup, but things went backwards in his second season. Nevertheless, the former England international showed plenty of signs of being a promising tactician.

Like Solskjaer, Carrick is unattached and would not require a compensation payment. He has a good chance of getting the role and would appear to have edged ahead in the race â€” perhaps because he current leadership team at United do not want to be seen to be rehashing old ideas by going back to Solskjaer, or maybe because he has impressed them the most during talks.

Likelihood:Â 7/10
Suitability:Â 6/10

On face value, United going for another stop-gap solution as manager would seem strange. There is around half of the season left to play, and they are firmly in the hunt for Champions League qualification. The campaign is far from a write-off, even considering their eliminations from the FA Cup and Carabao Cup.

However, there are justifiable reasons why they might wait before appointing their next permanent manager.

For one thing, parachuting Amorim into the job just didn't pay off. The Portuguese wanted to wait until the end of 2024/25 before taking over as Erik ten Hag's successor, but he was told it was "now or never" and chose to take the plunge. It's fair to say this did not work out too well for anyone concerned.

MORE:Ruben Amorim timeline at Man United, from Rashford clash to Leeds rant

It is also worth remembering that, although his overall time in charge was no great success, Solskjaer was a very good temporary boss when hired for that role in December 2018. After the toxicity of Mourinho's final months in charge, Solskjaer restored dressing-room morale, reconnected a disenchanted fan base, and got the players to enjoy playing more expressive, attacking football again. They won 14 of their first 17 games under the Norwegian, including a famous 3-1 Champions League victory at Paris Saint-Germain that resulted in an ill-advised clamour for United to hire him permanently. Their form only really began to tail off once talk of him getting the full-time job took hold.

Going for another temporary boss would give United the chance to pursue their objectives for the remainder of this season â€” specifically, Champions League qualification â€” while taking care to identify the best long-term candidate and then appointing that person in the summer, when far more managers will be more readily available as contracts with club sides and World Cup teams come to an end.

title: Darren Fletcher reaches same Man Utd verdict as Ruben Amorim after just two matches
description: Darren Fletcherâ€™s interim stint at Man Utd has not seen much progress, and it looks like he has come to the same conclusion about the club that Ruben Amorim once did. While there were a few positives to take from the draw with Burnley, Unitedâ€™s defence struggled badly in their 2-1 defeat to Brighton.
fullText:
Darren Fletcherâ€™s interim stint at Man Utd has not seen much progress, and it looks like he has come to the same conclusion about the club that Ruben Amorim once did.

While there were a few positives to take from the draw with Burnley, Unitedâ€™s defence struggled badly in their 2-1 defeat to Brighton.

Fletcher saw his team fall behind by two goals before Benjamin Sesko scored a late goal, which was no more than a consolation.

After the match, Fletcher reached a harsh verdict on this United squad, echoing concerns that fans had already heard during Amorimâ€™s tenure.

Amorim was known for his honesty during his time at Old Trafford, and while he had his shortcomings, fans generally appreciated his willingness to call things as he saw them.

Sometimes, though, he probably went a bit too far with it. That kind of bluntness does not always help in an environment like Manchester United, where the pressure is already high.

So when Fletcher came in with a more supportive tone and a bit of encouragement, it felt like the right change of pace from Amorimâ€™s constant focus on â€œsufferingâ€.

But it has not taken long for Fletcher to arrive at the same conclusion about the team that Amorim spoke about regularly.

After the loss to Brighton, the former midfielder said: â€œI think you can see the players are fragile. You need to dig deep. Build confidence by grinding out results. Of course we want to play good football but youâ€™ve got to find a way to do that. Once youâ€™ve done that hard work, attitude application.â€

The recurring theme of mental fragility was something that drove Amorim up the wall too.

The Portuguese coach often mentioned how United lost â€œin detailsâ€ more than anything tied to tactics or formation.

This same issue is what Fletcher has pointed out early in his own spell in charge.

This United squad looks stronger on paper than several teams from the past, but there is a clear difference in resilience between then and now.

Teams under Ole Gunnar Solskjaer and Jose Mourinho were known for their comebacks, something that often comes from having strong personalities and natural leaders within the squad.

Todayâ€™s group is younger overall, apart from a handful of experienced voices, and many of the new signings have arrived in a dressing room still feeling the effects of last season.

The next manager will need to focus as much on building mental strength as they do on tactics because many of Unitedâ€™s issues stem from a lack of belief and confidence.

Helping players feel more comfortable, taking some pressure off them, and creating an environment where they can perform freely should be at the top of the agenda.

But it will take time. Getting out of this rut will likely require more than just small changes or tweaks â€“ sustained winning form is needed to break free from old patterns.

title: John Fury promises to whip â€˜fatâ€™ son Tyson into â€˜Spartan shapeâ€™ by April
description: Tyson Fury is fat and out of shape â€¦ according to his father John Fury. John has been in and out of Tysonâ€™s fight camps for years, taking credit when his son wins and blaming others when his son loses. While â€œThe Gypsy Kingâ€ has announced his return to fighting in 2026, itâ€™s still not [â€¦]
fullText:
Tyson Fury is fat and out of shape â€¦ according to his father John Fury.

John has been in and out of Tysonâ€™s fight camps for years, taking credit when his son wins and blaming others when his son loses. While â€œThe Gypsy Kingâ€ has announced his return to fighting in 2026, itâ€™s still not clear what role his father will play on whatever team Tyson puts together. But John says heâ€™ll be right there with his son getting him prepared properly for one final championship run.

â€œI am going to be more involved this time,â€ Fury Sr. told Goldstar Promotions. â€œAnd hear this: Father and son â€¦ Tysonâ€™s going to win the heavyweight championship for the third time, and you can bank your f-cking money on that!â€

The Fury family patriarch didnâ€™t mince words when it came to a recent training video showing Tyson with rolls of fat spilling out over his shorts.

Tyson Fury back in training today looking like an absolute UNIT ğŸ˜… pic.twitter.com/Vwmvaz6mND

â€” Happy Punch (@HappyPunch) January 2, 2026

â€œHeâ€™s not in fantastic shape, thatâ€™s bullsh-t,â€ John admitted. â€œBut he will be. Have another look at him, because when I go out in the next week, there will be no more of this internet bullsh-t, every move on the internet. Head down, work, and get a body. Learn to move again. Learn to twist and be awkward. Herky jerky. Look like a fighter, man. Look like a warrior. Heâ€™ll look like a f-cking Spartan by April, and he will be heavyweight champion of the world again.â€

John pushed back on Tysonâ€™s past claims that a little extra weight helps him fight better.

â€œIt does matter. It f-cking does matter,â€ John declared. â€œIf itâ€™s muscle, it does not matter. If it is fat, it matters. Anybody will tell you that. But listen, we know where we are going. I know where he went wrong. I know. And we are going to put it right. And if Iâ€™m wrong, Iâ€™ll walk through London, main street, with no trousers on and Iâ€™ll eat out a f-cking donkey.â€

title: A.J. Brown's future with the Eagles in doubt after Wild Card loss
description: There are reasons to believe the all-world wide receiver could land somewhere else in 2026.
fullText:
For Philadelphia Eagles fans hoping to see A.J. Brown stick with the franchise after a tumultuous season, the events during and after Sunday's Wild Card Round loss to the San Francisco 49ers could not have been reassuring.

Brown, a three-time All-Pro and three-time Pro Bowl selection, has tallied 1,000-or-more receiving yards in six of his seven seasons in the league and has been crucial to the team's success in recent seasons. However, after expressing frustrations with his usage on social media earlier this season, things took a turn for the worse during the 23-19 loss to the 49ers on Sunday.

Brown had multiple dropped passes on Sunday, only hauling in three receptions for 25 yards, and at one point, head coach Nick Sirianni sprinted down the field to confront Brown after he wasn't leaving the field as the Eagles attempted to punt. This sparked a face-to-face confrontation, during which the two heatedly exchanged words before being separated. Sirianni told reporters on the sidelines that "emotions run high" and that "we're fine" before diving into the confrontation in more detail after the game.

Another look at the exchange between AJ Brown and HC Nick Sirianni on the sideline. pic.twitter.com/Syn0hr0MFK

â€” FOX Sports: NFL (@NFLonFOX) January 11, 2026

â€œI love A.J. I think he knows how I feel about him," Sirianni said. "I have a special relationship with him. Weâ€™ve probably went through every emotion you can possibly have together. Weâ€™ve laughed together, weâ€™ve cried together, weâ€™ve yelled at each other. Weâ€™re both emotional...that happens in this game.â€

Brown declined to speak with the press following the game in the locker room â€“ he went around the locker room giving multiple teammates hugs before immediately departing the team's facilities.

A.J. Brown just went around to a bunch of teammates in the locker room, hugged them, and bounced.

â€” Jimmy Kempski (@JimmyKempski) January 12, 2026

The day's events, both on the sidelines and after the game, suggest that Brown may not feel that his previous issues have been resolved with the Eagles, and in particular, his pot-game response to the situation indicates a player who could be convinced his tenure with the franchise may soon be coming to an end.

Brown, who has been with the Eagles for four seasons after starting his career with the Titans, signed an extension in 2024 that keeps him under contract through the 2029 season. Keep an eye on Brown's situation, as another trade could be in his future.

This article originally appeared on Touchdown Wire: A.J. Brown's future with Eagles in doubt after Wild Card loss.

title: Maye throws late TD pass and Patriotsâ€™ defense roughs up Herbert, Chargers in 16-3 playoff win
description: New England held Los Angeles to 207 yards of offense and sacked Justin Herbert six times.
fullText:
Patriots coach Mike Vrabel talked to his team about being prepared to bleed as New England entered its first playoff game since the 2021 season.

Then, shortly after Milton Williams sacked the Chargersâ€™ Justin Herbert on Sunday night to secure the Patriotsâ€™ first playoff victory in seven years, Williams celebrated with a head-butt of Vrabel.

It knocked the first-year coach backward and bloodied his lip.

â€œThe big dogs come out in January. I think Milt took that to heart,â€ Vrabel said. â€œHe came over and got me pretty good. But thatâ€™s what happens.â€

Drake Maye threw a touchdown pass to Hunter Henry in the fourth quarter, and New Englandâ€™s defense roughed up Herbert as the Patriots beat Los Angeles 16-3 in an AFC wild-card playoff game.

PLAYOFF DUBBBBBBBB pic.twitter.com/xTUemyhs8f

â€” New England Patriots (@Patriots) January 12, 2026

Andy Borregales kicked three field goals for the Patriots (15-3), who hadnâ€™t won in the postseason since their Super Bowl victory to cap the 2018 season. Theyâ€™ll host the winner of Monday nightâ€™s game between Pittsburgh and Houston in the divisional round.

In his playoff debut, Maye completed 17 of 29 passes for 268 yards and ran for a team-high 66 yards.

â€œWe made plays when we had to do it,â€ Maye said.

He also threw an interception and lost a fumble, but the Chargers (11-7) couldnâ€™t capitalize on those turnovers.

New England held Los Angeles to 207 yards of offense and sacked Herbert six times, with one of those resulting in a lost fumble that set up the Patriotsâ€™ TD.

â€œItâ€™s on us, what we do. Iâ€™ve been saying that all season,â€ Williams said. â€œWe can control the game. If we do what we need to do up front, weâ€™re going to win.â€

This is the second straight season in which the Chargers have lost in the wild-card round. Herbert finished 19 of 31 for 159 yards and was his teamâ€™s leading rusher with 57 yards as he fell to 0-3 in the playoffs.

Herbert was just over a month removed from surgery to repair a broken bone in his nonthrowing hand.

â€œThere was no issue,â€ Herbert said. â€œI just have to do a better job holding on to the ball.â€

Chargers coach Jim Harbaugh said his quarterback wasnâ€™t 100 percent.

THIS IS GORGEOUS ğŸ¯@DrakeMaye2 | @Hunter_Henry84 

ğŸ“º NBC pic.twitter.com/7TYUczWj3q

â€” New England Patriots (@Patriots) January 12, 2026

â€œHeâ€™s a warrior. He just gives it everything he has, all the time,â€ Harbaugh said, acknowledging that Herbert was limited by his hand injury. â€œItâ€™s an issue, but he doesnâ€™t flinch, like a warrior would.â€

The last time the Chargers failed to score a TD in the playoffs was their 21-12 AFC championship game loss to the Patriots during the 2007 season.

The Patriots drove into the red zone on their first possession of the third quarter, but the drive ended when Maye was strip-sacked by Odafe Oweh and Deâ€™Shawn Hand recovered for the Chargers.

After Los Angeles punted, Maye connected on a pass to Kayshon Boutte that went for 42 yards to set the Patriots up on the Chargers 27. But New England settled for a 39-yard field goal that stretched their lead to 9-3.

Early in the fourth quarter, Maye used a 16-yard pass to Boutte and a 13-yard burst by Rhamondre Stevenson to set up his precise 28-yard TD toss to Henry that put the Patriots in front 16-3.

GET ON THAT!!!!!!

ğŸ“º NBC pic.twitter.com/jRUgddmwbj

â€” New England Patriots (@Patriots) January 12, 2026

The Chargers picked up back-to-back first downs to open their ensuing drive. But when Herbert dropped back to pass on the next play, linebacker Kâ€™Lavon Chaisson strip-sacked him and fell on loose ball.

Los Angeles had one final possession, but it ended with Herbert getting sacked by Williams on fourth down.

â€œItâ€™s playoff football. Itâ€™s going to get ugly. Itâ€™s going to get nasty. But youâ€™ve got to keep going,â€ Williams said.

The opening quarter had lots of action, but it took until early in the second quarter for the Patriots to end a scoreless stalemate.

With New England pinned inside its own 10 after a Chargers punt, Maye had a pass intended for Austin Hooper tipped by Teair Tart and intercepted by Daiyan Henley.

Los Angeles started with the ball on the Patriots 10 but was stopped on fourth-and-2 when Herbert misfired a pass to Keenan Allen.

The Patriots took over and got some breathing room via a 48-yard catch-and-run by Stevenson.

Thirteen plays and a fourth-down conversion later, the drive ended with Borregalesâ€™ 23-yard field goal.

Patriots: CB Carlton Davis left in the first half with a toe injury but returned. ... CB Christian Gonzalez left in the second half with a head injury.

Patriots: Host either Houston or Pittsburgh next Sunday.

title: Inter continue to struggle against direct rivals after Napoli draw
description: Inter Milanâ€™s 2-2 draw with Napoli at San Siro has once again highlighted a growing issue in Cristian Chivuâ€™s side: their inability to win against direct rivals.Despite twice taking the lead again...
fullText:
Inter Milanâ€™s 2-2 draw with Napoli at San Siro has once again highlighted a growing issue in Cristian Chivuâ€™s side: their inability to win against direct rivals.

Despite twice taking the lead against Napoli, Inter were pegged back on both occasions, with Scott McTominay striking twice to deny the Nerazzurri a crucial victory.

The result leaves plenty still to play for in the Scudetto race, but it also extends a worrying run in big matches.

MILAN, ITALY â€“ JANUARY 11: Scott McTominay of SSC Napoli celebrates scoring his teamâ€™s second goal with teammate Amir Rrahmani during the Serie A match between FC Internazionale and SSC Napoli at Giuseppe Meazza Stadium on January 11, 2026 in Milan, Italy. (Photo by Marco Luzzani/Getty Images)

Inter are now without a win in their last 14 games against Milan, Napoli and Juventus across all competitions, recording seven draws and seven defeats in that period.

Their last success against one of those sides dates back to April 22, 2024, when they beat Milan in the derby to secure their 20th Scudetto under Simone Inzaghi.

Since then, results in direct clashes have consistently fallen short. Last season, draws against Napoli proved costly in the title race, and a similar pattern is emerging again this year.

MILAN, ITALY â€“ JANUARY 11: Hakan Calhanoglu of FC Internazionale Milano celebrates scoring his teamâ€™s second goal with teammates Henrikh Mkhitaryan and Lautaro Martinez during the Serie A match between FC Internazionale and SSC Napoli at Giuseppe Meazza Stadium on January 11, 2026 in Milan, Italy. (Photo by Marco Luzzani/Getty Images)

While tactical factors vary from game to game, the recurring theme suggests something deeper.

There is an increasing sense that Inter are suffering from a mental block in decisive fixtures, a lack of ruthlessness when it matters most. It is a problem Chivu has inherited from the final months of the Inzaghi era, and one he has yet to resolve.

title: Arizona Cardinals TE Trey McBride makes All-Pro first team
description: McBride was one vote short of a unanimous All-Pro selection.
fullText:
The Associated Press announced the 2025 NFL All-Pro first and second teams. The Arizona Cardinals had only one player make one of the squads, and it is no surprise.

Following his record-breaking season, tight end Trey McBride is a first-team All-Pro.

He was one vote short of joining Seattle Seahawks receiver Jaxon Smith-Njigba and Los Angeles Rams receiver Puka Nacua as the only unanimous first-team All-Pros. Forty-nine of the 50 voters gave McBride a first-place vote at tight end. The other went to San Francisco 49ers tight end George Kittle.

McBride finished the season with 126 receptions for 1,239 yards and 11 touchdowns.

He was second in the NFL in catches only to Nacua, who had 129. He set an NFL single-season record for receptions by a tight end, breaking Zach Ertz' 2018 mark of 116. He broke his own single-season franchise record for receptions by a tight end and set the franchise single-season record for receptions by anyone, beating DeAndre Hopkins' 2020 mark of 115.

His 1,239 yards are the most in a season in franchise history by a tight end. He was sixth in the NFL in receiving yards and tied for second in receiving touchdowns.

He was one of very few bright spots for the Cardinals in 2025, who went 3-14.

This will surely be the first of what could be many All-Pro nods for McBride in his career. He was also named a Pro Bowler for the second straight season.

Get more Cardinals and NFL coverage from Cards Wire's Jess Root and others by listening to the latest on the Rise Up, See Red podcast. Subscribe on Spotify,Â YouTubeÂ orÂ Apple podcasts.

This article originally appeared on Cards Wire: Arizona Cardinals TE Trey McBride makes All-Pro first team

title: â€œItâ€™s about winningâ€ â€“ Rosenior sends a message to fans with â€œidea of footballâ€ comments
description: Liam Rosenior has only been in the Chelsea job for less than a week, but heâ€™s already got a healthy 5-1 win under his belt, and more importantly, heâ€™s saying all the right things.The new boss was ...
fullText:
Liam Rosenior has only been in the Chelsea job for less than a week, but heâ€™s already got a healthy 5-1 win under his belt, and more importantly, heâ€™s saying all the right things.

The new boss was asked about his â€œidea of footballâ€, and basically dismissed that as unimportant compared to getting results, especially at this time of year.

Weâ€™d have to agree. While you want your manager to have a vision, you donâ€™t want them to be obsessed with that over the realities of the job.

Chelsea group of players in the fog. (Photo by Justin Setterfield/Getty Images)

â€œIâ€™m [only] one game in,â€™ the new boss said.

â€œSome of our passages of play were beautiful to watch. Weâ€™ve got magnificent players. My idea of football is not important. Itâ€™s about winning games of football consistently.

â€œItâ€™s a good start. Itâ€™s just the start and we have to stay consistent now in a very, very hectic schedule.â€To that end, he will basically be picking teams for freshness and fitness as much as anything.

On Wednesday night we will get our best idea of what his â€œfirst XIâ€ is, but beyond that itâ€™s going to be a chaotic few weeks where heâ€™s just got to try and grind out results with whoever is fittest, with limited training time.

You can see Rosenior speaking in the clip embedded here:

Only two Chelsea players won more duels than Facundo Buonanotte last night. He played well, created a lot in limited time on the pitch, and will have impressed anyone thinking of making a move for him in the summer.

Liam Rosenior got a big win in his first game â€“ as good as you can get new a new manager. But thereâ€™s a lot of negativity not to do with him at the club right now, that he has to deal with.

fullText:
After what happened in the semifinal of the Spanish Super Cup, the coach of AtlÃ©tico de Madrid has admitted that he did not act well.

Before the Copa del Rey match between AtlÃ©tico de Madrid and Deportivo de la CoruÃ±a, Simeone wanted to address what happened with Vinicius during the semifinal match of the Spanish Super Cup.

His now famous phrase "Florentino is going to kick you out, remember", today Simeone wanted to take a stand and acknowledge his mistake and therefore apologize.
